model_solution:
Step 1: We will rationalize the denominator of the given fraction by multiplying both the numerator and the denominator by its conjugate. The conjugate of $2 + i$ is $2 - i$.
Step 2: $\displaystyle \left|\dfrac{(2-4i)(2-i)}{(2+i)(2-i)}\right| = \left|\dfrac{4-8i-2i+4i^2}{4-2i+2i- i^2}\right| = \left|\dfrac{4-10i-4}{4+1}\right| = \left|\dfrac{-10i}{5}\right| = \left|\dfrac{-10}{1}i\right| = |-10i|$.
Step 3: $|-10i| = \sqrt{(-10)^2} = \sqrt{100} = 10$.
Step 4: We conclude that $\left|\dfrac{2-4i}{2+i}\right| = 10$.
Step 5: $\left|\dfrac{-10i}{1}\right| = |-10i| = 10.$
Step 6: $\left|\dfrac{-10i}{1}\right| = |-10i| = 10.$
Step 7: $\left|\dfrac{-10i}{1}\right| = |-10i| = 10.$
Step 3: $|-10i| = \sqrt{(-10)^2} = \sqrt{100} = 10$.
steps: Step 1: We will rationalize the denominator of the given fraction by multiplying both the numerator and the denominator by its conjugate. The conjugate of $2 + i$ is $2 - i$.
full_steps: Step 1: We will rationalize the denominator of the given fraction by multiplying both the numerator and the denominator by its conjugate. The conjugate of $2 + i$ is $2 - i$.
